item.caption: â¢
item.content: BYETTA should not be used after the expiration date printed on the pen label.

paragraph.content: How do I clean my BYETTA Pen?

list.item: â¢Wipe the outside of the pen with a clean, damp cloth.
â¢White particles may appear on the outside tip of the cartridge during normal use. You may remove them with an alcohol wipe or alcohol swab.

paragraph.content: See the complete BYETTA Medication Guide that comes with BYETTA. For more information, call toll free 1-800-236-9933.
Read and follow the directions in this section only after you've read Section 1âWhat You Need To Know About Your BYETTA Pen.

td.paragraph: Set up your new pen just before you use it the first time. For routine use, do not repeat this one-time-only new pen setup. If you do, you will run out of BYETTA before 30 days of use.
Note: Small air bubbles in the cartridge are normal.

list.item: â¢Wash hands prior to use.
â¢Check pen label to make sure it is your 5 mcg pen.
â¢Pull off the blue pen cap.
â¢Check BYETTA in the cartridge. The liquid should be clear, colorless, and free of particles. If not, do not use.
â¢Remove paper tab from outer needle shield.
â¢ Push outer needle shield containing the needle straight onto the pen, then screw needle on until secure.
â¢Pull off outer needle shield. Do not throw away.
â¢Pull off inner needle shield and throw away. A small drop of liquid may appear. This is normal.
â¢Check that the is in the dose window. If not, turn dose knob away from you (clockwise) until it stops and the is in the dose window.
â¢ Pull dose knob out until it stops and the is in the dose window.
â¢ Turn dose knob away from you until it stops at . Make sure that the 5 with the line under it is in the center of the dose window.

td.paragraph: Note: If you cannot turn the dose knob away from you to the , see Commonly Asked Questions, number 7, in Section 4 of these Instructions for Use.

list.item: â¢Point the needle of the pen up and away from you.
â¢ Use thumb to firmly push injection button in until it stops, then continue holding the injection button in while slowly counting to 5.

item.caption: â¢
item.content: If you do not see a stream or several drops come from the needle tip, repeat Steps C & D.

list.item: â¢Pen preparation is complete when the is in the center of the dose window and you have seen a stream or several drops come from the needle tip.

td.paragraph: Note: If you do not see liquid after 4 times, see Commonly Asked Questions, number 3, in Section 4 of these Instructions for Use.

paragraph.content: STEP E Complete New Pen Setup

list.item: â¢ Turn dose knob away from you until it stops and the is in the dose window.
â¢ For routine use, do not repeat this one-time-only new pen setup. If you do, you will run out of BYETTA before 30 days of use.
â¢You are now ready for your first dose of BYETTA.

item.caption: â¢
item.content: Go to Section 3, Step 3, for instructions on how to inject your first routine dose.

td.paragraph: Note: If you cannot turn the dose knob, see Commonly Asked Questions, number 7, in Section 4 of Instructions for Use.

paragraph.content: Now that you have done the one-time-only new pen setup, follow Section 3 for all of your injections.

td.paragraph: Note: Small air bubbles will not harm you or affect your dose.

list.item: â¢Wash hands prior to use.
â¢Check pen label to make sure it is your 5 mcg pen.
â¢Pull off the blue pen cap.
â¢Check BYETTA in the cartridge.
â¢The liquid should be clear, colorless, and free of particles. If it is not, do not use.
â¢Remove paper tab from outer needle shield.
â¢ Push outer needle shield containing the needle straight onto pen, then screw needle on until secure.
â¢Pull off outer needle shield. Do not throw away.
â¢Pull off inner needle shield and throw away. A small drop of liquid may appear. This is normal.
â¢Check that the is in the dose window. If not, turn dose knob away from you (clockwise) until it stops and the is in the dose window.
â¢ Pull dose knob out until it stops and the is in the dose window.
â¢ Turn dose knob away from you until it stops at . Make sure that the 5 with the line under it is in the center of the dose window.

td.paragraph: Note: If you cannot turn the dose knob away from you to the , see Commonly Asked Questions, number 7, in Section 4 of these Instructions for Use.

list.item: â¢Grip pen firmly.
â¢Insert needle into skin using the under-the-skin (subcutaneous) injection method explained by your healthcare provider.
â¢ Use thumb to firmly push injection button in until it stops. Continue holding in the injection button while slowly counting to 5 to get a full dose.
â¢Remove needle from skin.
â¢Injection is complete when the is in the center of the dose window.
â¢The pen is now ready to reset.

td.paragraph: Note: If you see several drops of BYETTA leaking from the needle after the injection, you may not have received a complete dose. See Commonly Asked Questions, number 4, in Section 4 of these Instructions for Use.

list.item: â¢ Turn dose knob away from you until it stops and the is in the dose window.

td.paragraph: Note: If you cannot turn the dose knob, or if your pen leaks, your full dose has not been delivered. See Commonly Asked Questions, numbers 4 and 7, in Section 4 of these Instructions for Use.

paragraph.content: STEP 6 Remove and Dispose of the Needle

list.item: â¢Carefully put the outer needle shield back over the needle.

item.caption: â¢
item.content: Remove the needle after each injection.

list.item: â¢Unscrew the needle.
â¢Throw away needles in a FDA-cleared sharps disposal container (See above âHow do I throw away my needles?â) or as recommended by your healthcare provider.

paragraph.content: STEP 7 Store Pen for Next Dose

list.item: â¢Replace Blue Pen Cap on pen before storage.
â¢Store your BYETTA Pen at a temperature between 36Â°F to 77Â°F (2Â°C to 25Â°C). (See Storing Your BYETTA Pen in Section 1 of these Instructions for Use for complete storage information.)
â¢When it is time for your next routine dose, go to Section 3, Step 1, and repeat Steps 1â7.

paragraph.content: Do I need to do the One-Time-Only New Pen Setup before every dose?

list.item: â¢No. The One-Time-Only New Pen Setup is done only once, just before each new pen is used for the first time.
â¢The purpose of the setup is to make sure that your BYETTA Pen is ready to use for the next 30 days.

â¢ If you repeat the One-Time-Only New Pen Setup before each routine dose, you will not have enough BYETTA for 30 days. The small amount of BYETTA used in the new pen setup will not affect the 30-day supply of BYETTA.

paragraph.content: Why are there air bubbles in the cartridge?

list.item: â¢A small air bubble is normal. It will not harm you or affect your dose.
â¢If the pen is stored with a needle attached, air bubbles may form in the cartridge. Do not store the pen with the needle attached.

paragraph.content: What should I do if BYETTA does not come out of the needle tip after four tries during One-Time-Only New Pen Setup?

list.item: â¢Carefully put the outer needle shield back over the needle. Remove the needle by unscrewing it. Throw away the needle properly.

â¢Attach a new needle and repeat One-Time-Only New Pen Setup, Steps BâE, in Section 2 of these Instructions for Use. Once you see several drops or a stream of liquid coming out of the tip of the needle, the setup is complete.

paragraph.content: Why do I see BYETTA leaking from my needle after I have finished my injection?

td.paragraph:
Â
It is normal for a single drop to remain on the tip of your needle after your injection is complete. If you see more than one drop:

list.item: â¢You may not have received your full dose. Do not inject another dose. Talk with your healthcare provider about what to do about a partial dose.
â¢To make sure that you get your full dose, when you take your injections, firmly push and hold the injection button in and slowly count to 5 (see Section 3, Step 4: Inject the Dose).

paragraph.content: How can I tell when the injection is complete?

list.item: â¢You have firmly pushed the injection button in all the way until it stops
â¢ You have slowly counted to 5 while you are still holding the injection button in and the needle is still in your skin
â¢The is in the center of the dose window.

td.paragraph: If you hear a click sound from your BYETTA Pen, ignore it. You must follow all the steps listed above to make sure your injection is complete.
Inject BYETTA into your abdomen, thigh, or upper arm using the injection method explained to you by your healthcare provider.
Change (rotate) your injection sites within the area you choose for each dose.Â Do notÂ use the same injection site for each injection.

paragraph.content: What if I cannot pull, turn, or push the dose knob?

td.paragraph: Check the symbol in the dose window. Follow the steps next to the matching symbol.

list.item: â¢Pull the dose knob out until appears.

paragraph.content: is in the dose window and the dose knob will not turn:

list.item: â¢The cartridge in your BYETTA Pen may not have enough medicine to deliver a full dose. A small amount of BYETTA will always stay in the cartridge. If the cartridge contains a small amount and the dose knob will not turn, your pen does not have enough BYETTA and will not deliver any more doses. Get a new BYETTA Pen.

paragraph.content: are in the dose window and the dose knob cannot be pushed in:

list.item: â¢The dose knob was not turned all the way. Continue turning the dose knob away from you until is in the center of the dose window.

paragraph.content: are in the dose window and the dose knob cannot be pushed in:

list.item: â¢The needle may be clogged, bent, or incorrectly attached.
â¢Attach a new needle. Make sure needle is on straight and screwed on all the way.
â¢Firmly push the injection button in all the way. BYETTA should come from needle tip.

paragraph.content: is in the dose window and the dose knob will not turn:

list.item: â¢The injection button was not pushed in all the way and a complete dose was not delivered. Talk with your healthcare provider about what to do about a partial dose.

â¢Follow these steps to reset your pen for your next injection:
âFirmly push the injection button in all the way until it stops. Keep holding the injection button in and slowly count to 5. Then release the injection button and turn the dose knob away from you until appears in the dose window.
âIf you cannot turn the dose knob, the needle may be clogged. Replace the needle and repeat the step above.
â¢For your next dose, be sure to firmly push and hold the injection button in and slowly count to 5 before removing needle from skin.

paragraph.content: STEP 6 Remove and Dispose of the Needle

list.item: â¢Carefully put the outer needle shield back over the needle.

item.caption: â¢
item.content: Remove the needle after each injection.

list.item: â¢Unscrew the needle.
â¢Throw away needles in a FDA-cleared sharps disposal container (See above âHow do I throw needles?â) or as recommended by your healthcare provider.

paragraph.content: STEP 7 Store Pen for Next Dose

list.item: â¢Replace Blue Pen Cap on pen before storage.
â¢Store your BYETTA Pen at a temperature between 36Â°F to 77Â°F (2Â°C to 25Â°C). (See Storing Your BYETTA Pen in Section 1 of these Instructions for Use for complete storage information.)
â¢When it is time for your next routine dose, go to Section 3, Step 1, and repeat Steps 1â7.

paragraph.content: Do I need to do the One-Time-Only New Pen Setup before every dose?

list.item: â¢No. The One-Time-Only New Pen Setup is done only once, just before each new pen is used for the first time.
â¢The purpose of the setup is to make sure that your BYETTA Pen is ready to use for the next 30 days.

â¢ If you repeat the One-Time-Only New Pen Setup before each routine dose, you will not have enough BYETTA for 30 days. The small amount of BYETTA used in the new pen setup will not affect the 30-day supply of BYETTA.

paragraph.content: Why are there air bubbles in the cartridge?

list.item: â¢A small air bubble is normal. It will not harm you or affect your dose.
â¢If the pen is stored with a needle attached, air bubbles may form in the cartridge. Do not store the pen with the needle attached.

paragraph.content: What should I do if BYETTA does not come out of the needle tip after four tries during One-Time-Only New Pen Setup?

list.item: â¢Carefully put the outer needle shield back over the needle. Remove the needle by unscrewing it. Throw away the needle properly.

â¢Attach a new needle and repeat One-Time-Only New Pen Setup, Steps BâE, in Section 2 of these Instructions for Use. Once you see several drops or a stream of liquid coming out of the tip of the needle, the setup is complete.

paragraph.content: Why do I see BYETTA leaking from my needle after I have finished my injection?

td.paragraph:
Â
It is normal for a single drop to remain on the tip of your needle after your injection is complete. If you see more than one drop:

list.item: â¢You may not have received your full dose. Do not inject another dose. Talk with your healthcare provider about what to do about a partial dose.
â¢To make sure that you get your full dose, when you take your injections, firmly push and hold the injection button in and slowly count to 5 (see Section 3, Step 4: Inject the Dose).

paragraph.content: How can I tell when the injection is complete?

list.item: â¢You have firmly pushed the injection button in all the way until it stops
â¢ You have slowly counted to 5 while you are still holding the injection button in and the needle is still in your skin
â¢The is in the center of the dose window.

td.paragraph: If you hear a click sound from your BYETTA Pen, ignore it. You must follow all the steps listed above to make sure your injection is complete.
Inject BYETTA into your abdomen, thigh, or upper arm using the injection method explained to you by your healthcare provider.
Change (rotate) your injection sites within the area you choose for each dose.Â Do notÂ use the same injection site for each injection.

paragraph.content: What if I cannot pull, turn, or push the dose knob?

td.paragraph: Check the symbol in the dose window. Follow the steps next to the matching symbol.

list.item: â¢Pull the dose knob out until appears.

paragraph.content: is in the dose window and the dose knob will not turn:

list.item: â¢The cartridge in your BYETTA Pen may not have enough medicine to deliver a full dose. A small amount of BYETTA will always stay in the cartridge. If the cartridge contains a small amount and the dose knob will not turn, your pen does not have enough BYETTA and will not deliver any more doses. Obtain a new BYETTA Pen.

paragraph.content: are in the dose window and the dose knob cannot be pushed in:

list.item: â¢The dose knob was not turned all the way. Continue turning the dose knob away from you until is in the center of the dose window.

paragraph.content: are in the dose window and the dose knob cannot be pushed in:

list.item: â¢The needle may be clogged, bent, or incorrectly attached.
â¢Attach a new needle. Make sure needle is on straight and screwed on all the way.
â¢Firmly push the injection button in all the way. BYETTA should come from needle tip.

paragraph.content: is in the dose window and the dose knob will not turn:

list.item: â¢The injection button was not pushed in all the way and a complete dose was not delivered. Talk with your healthcare provider about what to do about a partial dose.

â¢Follow these steps to reset your pen for your next injection:
âFirmly push the injection button in all the way until it stops. Keep holding the injection button in and slowly count to 5. Then release the injection button and turn the dose knob away from you until appears in the dose window.
âIf you cannot turn the dose knob, the needle may be clogged. Replace the needle and repeat the step above.
â¢For your next dose, be sure to firmly push and hold the injection button in and slowly count to 5 before removing needle from skin.

paragraph.content: See the complete BYETTA Medication Guide that comes with BYETTA. For more information, call toll free 1-800-236-9933.
